DocumentNotes.Note:
A vulnerability in the Link Layer Discovery Protocol (LLDP) packet processing code of Cisco IOS could allow an unauthenticated, adjacent attacker to cause the crash of an affected device.
The vulnerability is due to improper handling of crafted LLDP packets. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially crafted LLDP packet. An exploit could allow the attacker to cause a Denial of Service (DoS) condition on an affected platform.
Cisco has released software updates that address this vulnerability. There are no workarounds that address this vulnerability.
This advisory is available at the following link: http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160616-ios1["http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160616-ios1"]

Vulnerability.Title: Cisco IOS Link Layer Discovory Protocol Processing Code Denial of Service Vulnerability

Notes.Note:
A vulnerability in the Link Layer Discovery Protocol (LLDP) packet processing code of Cisco IOS could allow an unauthenticated, adjacent attacker to cause the crash of an affected device.
The vulnerability is due to improper handling of crafted LLDP packets. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially crafted LLDP packet. An exploit could allow the attacker to cause a Denial of Service (DoS) condition on an affected platform.

Remediation.Description: No workarounds are available for this vulnerability but administrators may choose to disable LLDP packet processing.
